description: System-generated surrogate key uniquely identifying the saved query definition.
User-assigned name or identifier for the saved query, used for selection and display.
Free-text or encoded notes/flags describing the query; values appear semicolon-delimited; likely stores metadata rather than prose; confirm with SME.
Functional area or entity type the query targets; determines which data set and fields are available.
List of fields to return in results; may support wildcards or comma-separated field names.
Serialized filter criteria defining field/operator/value conditions for the query; stored in a delimited format for the application to parse.
Sort specification for query results, including field(s) and direction.
Default logical operator used to join multiple filter conditions when building the query; likely AND or OR.
System timestamp when this query definition was last updated.
Timestamp of the last user-initiated change to this query; may mirror last_modified depending on implementation; confirm distinction with SME.
Identifier of the user who originally created the query definition.
Timestamp when the query definition was created by a user.
Identifier of the user who last modified the query definition.
Timestamp when the query was last modified by a user; may duplicate user_last_modified; confirm with SME.
